Class SearchViewController

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.swdesign.movienightplanner.controllers.SearchViewController
public class SearchViewController extends Object
Controller class for handling the search view of the application. It manages movie lists, filter options, and transitions between views such as profile and movie details.
Author:
Make, ChatGPT(setComboBoxLogic, Javadoc comments)

      public SearchViewController()

  • Method Details

    • setSceneController

      public void setSceneController(SceneController sceneController)

    • setAppState

      public void setAppState(AppState appState)

    • setFilterViewController

      public void setFilterViewController(FilterViewController filterViewController)

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the search view components, sets backgrounds, populates movie lists, and configures filter options. This method is called automatically after the FXML components have been loaded.

    • initializeFilters

      public void initializeFilters()
      Initializes filters for the search view, setting up filter options for genres, audio, subtitles, and streaming providers. Clears any previously cached movie labels.

    • populateSearchHistory

      public void populateSearchHistory()
      Populates the user's search history in the search view list. Retrieves the history from the application state.

    • setSearch

      public void setSearch()
      Sets up the search bar to handle text changes and triggers search functionality when the Enter key is pressed.

    • setupLoadingLabels

      private void setupLoadingLabels()
      Sets up the loading labels for various movie lists in the UI. Configures style, placeholder text, and layout orientation.

    • showLoadingLabel

      private void showLoadingLabel()
      Displays a loading label when filtering movies. The label informs the user that a filtering operation is in progress.

    • hideLoadingLabel

      private void hideLoadingLabel()
      Hides the loading label after filtering movies.

    • showHistoryLabel

      private void showHistoryLabel()
      Displays the search history label and adjusts the layout of the search view. This is used when the search bar is empty, showing the user's recent searches.

    • hideHistoryLabel

      private void hideHistoryLabel()
      Hides the search history label and clears the search list view. Adjusts the layout back to its default state.

    • handleProfileButtonClick

      public void handleProfileButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action of switching to the profile view when the profile button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by clicking the profile button.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while switching the scene.

    • handleFilterButtonClick

      private void handleFilterButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action of applying filters when the filter button is clicked. This filters the movies based on selected genres, audio, subtitles, and streaming providers.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by clicking the filter button.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during filtering.

    • handleSearchClick

      private void handleSearchClick() throws IOException
      Performs a search based on the query entered in the search bar. Updates the search list view asynchronously with results from the TMDb API. Displays a "searching" placeholder during the operation and shows an error message if the search fails.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during the search process.

    • setMovieListView

      private void setMovieListView(List<Movie> movies, javafx.scene.control.ListView<Movie> lView, Runnable loadMoreAction)
      Populates a ListView with movie data. Each movie is displayed using custom labels that are loaded from an FXML file. These labels are cached for better performance.
      Parameters:
      movies - the list of movies to display in the ListView
      lView - the ListView component that will display the movie labels

    • setMovieGridView

      private void setMovieGridView(List<Movie> movies, org.controlsfx.control.GridView<Movie> lView)
      Populates a GridView with movie data. Each movie is displayed using custom labels that are loaded from an FXML file. These labels are cached for better performance.
      Parameters:
      movies - the list of movies to display in the GridView
      lView - the GridView component that will display the movie labels

    • handleMovieClick

      private void handleMovieClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event, Movie movie, boolean isSearch)
      Handles the event when a movie label is clicked. Switches the scene to the movie detail view.
      Parameters:
      event - The mouse event triggered by clicking a movie label.
      movie - The movie object whose details should be shown.

    • populateMovieListAsync

      private void populateMovieListAsync(javafx.scene.control.Label loadingLabel, javafx.scene.Node lView, String url, boolean append)
      Populates the list of movies for search results or specific categories asynchronously. Supports both ListView and GridView components.
      Parameters:
      loadingLabel - The label to display while movies are being loaded.
      lView - The UI element (ListView or GridView) where the movies will be displayed.
      url - The URL to fetch movies from.
      append - Whether to append to the existing list or replace it.

    • populateListViewAsync

      private void populateListViewAsync(javafx.scene.control.Label loadingLabel, javafx.scene.control.ListView<Movie> listView, String url, boolean append)
      Populates a ListView asynchronously by fetching movie data from the given URL. If the `append` parameter is true, new movies are added to the existing list. If `append` is false, the current list is replaced with the new set of movies.
      Parameters:
      loadingLabel - The label to display while loading the movie list.
      listView - The ListView to populate with movie items.
      url - The URL to fetch movie data from.
      append - If true, new movies are appended to the existing list; otherwise, the list is being made for first time.

    • loadMoreMovies

      private void loadMoreMovies(javafx.scene.Node lView)
      Loads more movies into the specified ListView by determining the appropriate URL and fetching new results. The new results are then appended to the existing list of movies.
      Parameters:
      lView - The ListView to which new movie results will be appended.

    • populateGridViewAsync

      private void populateGridViewAsync(org.controlsfx.control.GridView<Movie> lView)
      Populates a GridView asynchronously by fetching movie data across multiple pages. This method will start fetching from the first page and continue until 10 pages are retrieved.
      Parameters:
      lView - The GridView to populate with movie items.

    • fetchNextPage

      private void fetchNextPage(org.controlsfx.control.GridView<Movie> lView)
      Fetches the next page of movie data and adds it to the provided list of movies. Once the movies are loaded, the GridView is updated, and the next page is fetched recursively. The process stops after 10 pages.
      Parameters:
      lView - The GridView to populate with movie items.

    • determineUrlForNode

      private String determineUrlForNode(javafx.scene.Node lView)
      Determines the appropriate URL for the movie list based on the given ListView node. This method selects the correct URL for popular movies, top-rated movies, or filtered movies.
      Parameters:
      lView - The ListView to determine the URL for.
      Returns:
      The URL to fetch movie data from, or null if no URL could be determined.

    • createFilteredMoviesUrl

      private String createFilteredMoviesUrl()
      Creates a URL for fetching filtered movie data based on the selected genres, audio, providers, and minimum rating.
      Returns:
      The URL to fetch filtered movie data from.

    • updateFilterData

      public void updateFilterData()
      Updates the filter settings in the UI based on the user's preferences stored in the application state. The method synchronizes the state of checkboxes and other UI components to reflect the user's preferred streaming providers, genres, and audio options. It also sets the minimum rating filter.

    • setMinRating

      public void setMinRating(Integer rating)
      Sets the minimum rating for the filter. This method updates the internal state to reflect the desired minimum rating.
      Parameters:
      rating - The minimum rating to be set (e.g., a value between 1 and 10).
